snippet: Ms. Brown, who wrote the best-selling book “Sex and the Single Girl” and was the longtime editor of Cosmopolitan, was widely credited with being the first to introduce frank discussions of sex into magazines for women.
abstract: Helen Gurley Brown, author of best-selling book Sex and the Single Girl and longtime editor of Cosmopolitan magazine, dies at age 90; Brown, an outspoken advocate of women's sexual freedom, was widely credited with being the first to introduce frank discussions of sex into magazines for women.
lead_paragraph: Ms. Brown, who wrote the best-selling book “Sex and the Single Girl” and was the longtime editor of Cosmopolitan, was widely credited with being the first to introduce frank discussions of sex into magazines for women.
